solution_line_template: Max can deliver a maximum of {maximum_daily_packages} * {working_days_per_week} = <<{maximum_daily_packages}*{working_days_per_week}={max_weekly_capacity}>>{max_weekly_capacity} packages in one week.

For {days_at_max_performance} days Max has carried the maximum number of packages, which in total means {days_at_max_performance} * {maximum_daily_packages} = <<{days_at_max_performance}*{maximum_daily_packages}={packages_delivered_at_max_performance}>>{packages_delivered_at_max_performance} packages.
One day Max has carried only 1/7 * {maximum_daily_packages} = <<1/7*{maximum_daily_packages}={packages_delivered_one_seventh}>>{packages_delivered_one_seventh} packages.
On two other days, Max delivered only 4/5 * {maximum_daily_packages} = <<4/5*{maximum_daily_packages}={packages_delivered_four_fifth}>>{packages_delivered_four_fifth} packages.

That means, Max could deliver {max_weekly_capacity} - {packages_delivered_four_fifth} - {packages_delivered_one_seventh} - {packages_delivered_at_max_performance} - {packages_unloaded_other_two_days} = <<{max_weekly_capacity}-{packages_delivered_four_fifth}-{packages_delivered_one_seventh}-{packages_delivered_at_max_performance}-{packages_unloaded_other_two_days}={remaining_capacity}>>{remaining_capacity} more packages.
